reviewText: Though the movie uses an oft told tale of the Nazi occupation in France during World War II, the movie gives some new twists and turns in the occupation.  But the primary difference is John Thaw.  He can play any part so superbly, that an old tale become new.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had heard about this series from the wgbn-newsletter, I rented it from NetFlix and before the first episode was over, I had been online to AOL to order my own copy. I may collect all things John Thaw. It would have been a privledge to meet and talk with him. We will miss him.

reviewText: My wife & I loved this piece.  It's pedigree as a finely produced & directed period piece was evident from the start.  The acting is impeccable and wonderful.  I highly recommend this John Thaw piece.
summary: Well worth the few pence it costs.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This file is high on my list of favourites because of the superb acting of John Thaw.  I loved him as Inspector Morse; he's even a better priest.  The action takes place in Nazi-occupied France and holds one interest throughout.  The supporting actors are of the highest calibre..Treat yourself..
summary: An all-time favourite actor in a superb performance
Title: N/A
